In 2006, podcasting continued to ride the coattails of this hype. The Ricky Gervais Show became the most downloaded podcast in history, and the worldâ€™s first live podcast tour took to the road.<sup><a href=../citations/index.html>6</a></sup> *This American Life*, a weekly public radio program founded by Ira Glass in 1996, jumped on the bandwagon, making the show freely available as a podcast for the first time. Edison Research reported that at the time [22 percent of Americans were aware of the term podcasting and 11 percent of the population had listened to a podcast at least once](http://www.edisonresearch.com/the-podcast-consumer-2015/).<sup><a href=../citations/index.html>7</a></sup>
